  • Field Details

    • playerRaceChoice

      private javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<String> playerRaceChoice
      Dropdown to choose the player's monster

    • computerRaceChoice

      private javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<String> computerRaceChoice
      Dropdown to choose the computer's monster

    • beginBattle

      private javafx.scene.control.Button beginBattle
      The button to begin the battle

    • raceChoiceList

      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> raceChoiceList
      A list containing the pretty names of each available class. Updated by updateRaceList()

    • raceNameMap

      private HashMap<String,Class<? extends Monster>> raceNameMap
      A HashMap that stores a pretty name and the class for each monster available. It allows for easy retrieving of classes chosen by the dropdowns

    • playerMonster

      private Class<? extends Monster> playerMonster
      The class that will be used to spawn the player's monster

    • computerMonster

      private Class<? extends Monster> computerMonster
      The class that will be used to spawn the computer's monster

    • beginBattleConsumer

      private BiConsumer<Class<? extends Monster>,Class<? extends Monster>> beginBattleConsumer
      BiConsumer that is called when the button to begin the battle is called

    • BattleBeginController

      public BattleBeginController()

  • Method Details

    • addMonster

      public void addMonster(Class<? extends Monster> monsterClass)
      Add a new monster class to raceNameMap.
      Parameters:
      monsterClass - Class to add to the map

    • initRaceDropdowns

      public void initRaceDropdowns()
      Set the options for the monster choosing dropdowns to the list of monsters updated by updateRaceList().

    • updateRaceList

      private void updateRaceList()
      Update the list of possible monsters from raceNameMap and sort them in alphabetical order

    • beginBattleAction

      public void beginBattleAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that is called when the button to begin the battle is pressed. It passes the player's class and the computer's class to beginBattleConsumer
      Parameters:
      event - Event generated by JavaFX

    • playerChooseAction

      public void playerChooseAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that is called when the value for the player monster dropdown is updated. It updates the variable for the player's class, getting a random one if needed, and checks if the button to begin the battle should be enabled.
      Parameters:
      event - Event generated by JavaFX

    • computerChooseAction

      public void computerChooseAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that is called whenever the value for the computer monster dropdown is updated. It updates the variable for the computer's class, getting a random one if needed, and checks if the button to begin the battle should be enabled.
      Parameters:
      event - Event generated by JavaFX

    • updateButtonVisibility

      private void updateButtonVisibility()
      Checks if the button to begin the battle should be enabled. It will only be enabled if both dropdowns have a value selected

    • getRandomMonster

      private Class<? extends Monster> getRandomMonster()
      Gets a random monster class from the list of available classes
      Returns:
      A random monster from raceChoiceList

    • onBeginBattle

      public void onBeginBattle(BiConsumer<Class<? extends Monster>,Class<? extends Monster>> consumer)
      Sets a BiConsumer that is called when a new battle is begun
      Parameters:
      consumer - Consumer that will be called when a new battle is begun

    • printStackTrace

      public void printStackTrace()
      Debug method used to print out the current stack trace. Throws a simple RuntimeException that will be caught.
